She is good at making clear what is on each test and answers any questions you have. Take her if you can!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Caring--Would take again

comment: READ CAREFULLY : *Every week you got a lab quiz that required lockdown browser 10 minutes for 10 questions. *SHE DOESN'T PROVIDE STUDY GUIDES FOR ANY OF HER TESTS !!! you wanna pass, get ready to go over MORE than 150 slides of powerpoint *Her final is CUMULTATIVE thats 5 chapters x 150 slides  750 slides to study for ur final TAKE ANY1 BUT HER
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--Tests are tough

comment: Professor Alme is known for being a tough teacher. However, she is constantly reminding her students to ask questions and she genuinely wants you to pass her class. Attendance isn't mandatory. MULTIPLE resources are available and if you do the work, you will get the grade you want. I wish she taught 1102!
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY--Amazing lectures

comment: Would not recommend. Makes the class way more difficult than it should be. This is a base line level class with major class standards. Very frustrating! The work is not difficult but she tries her best to make it.

Keep in mind when taking this class it is a 4 hour credit class, so youre going to have to do work. Attendance isnt mandatory, but she has 7ish random in class assignments that she uses for an attendance grade. Really tries to connect material to real life examples. Do the work and study before the test and youll be fine. VKSU Extra credit option.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Im not sure why there are negative reviews on this class. I took the shortened eight week class, there were 11 ten question quizzes (only 9 taken in the final grade), 5 lab quizzes, 4 exams and a final, and two discussion post. I have not opened up one book or one lab, found everything on quizlet, and already have a low A without the final.

This is a summer course and I DO NOT RECOMMEND!! There is 8-10 hours of assignments every week. As a normal online class, it may be fine, but being condensed into a summer class meant nothing to her. It is a ridiculous amount of work for a summer online class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor Alme offers an excellent online class.  You have weekly MES homework, which is actually enjoyable imo.  You have 4 lab quizzes even though you don't turn in your labs. You must be very familiar with them as you only have less than a minute per question for the quizzes.  I thought the tests were fair if you studied. I would take her again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: 5 tests (including final) and 5 lab quizzes, lowest 1 of each dropped. Weekly MES homework and quizzes. 3 discussion posts, but she only grades one of them. Kind of a lot of work for an online Science class, but extremely easy to get an A. Lockdown browser for tests, but no webcam. Understand the labs b4 the quiz, because she gives no time.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: Dr. Alme was amazing!! She was the most engaging professor I've ever had. I wish I could take her again for 1102, but she's not teaching it. This class was challenging, you actually have to study *GASP*. This professor isn't going to spoon feed you the answers on the test. Open a book, take notes, go to class, pass the class. Easy. Best of luck!!
rating_tags: Inspirational--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: More work than all of my classes combined this semester. Study her powerpoints and you should be fine for the test, but probably 20 hours of studying for each test. Homework due once a week, labs you don't need to do, just know the concepts. Way more work than necessary for a gen ed class. Avoid at all costs.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: She gives you 20 minutes to take a 25 question quiz, or 15 minutes to take a 10 question quiz and expects you to know every single question by heart.  You have to fill out and take notes on the labs to understand any of the quiz material.  20 question graded activity and one lab quiz every week.  Tests are pretty easy and you have plenty of time.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: I took this class online and it was honestly harder than I expected, but still not terrible. There was quite a bit of work involved, but as long as you actually applied yourself it wasn't hard to pass.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor Alme is pretty good. Easy lecture, just take notes and she gives a preview of what is to expect of the lab for that week. SHOW UP TO THE LECTURES. She'll ask questions about the labs on the test. Volunteer for extra credit! 2 points for each (do up to 5 for 10 points extra on your final grade)
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Run away fast !!! If taking SCI 1101 online then take anyone but her.  She is so convinced that everyone taking the online class is cheating that she berates the class constantly and keeps reducing the test/quiz time.  She has sucked every bit of life from this class and made me hate it.  Complains that no-one goes to SI but controls what he says.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Awesome, knowledgeable professor. Attend lectures and you should be able to keep up without having to read so much. She makes the class very interesting and inspired me to change my major to Environmental Engineering.
rating_tags: Inspirational--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Took this class during the Fall semester of 2016. The tests were hard, and she was unprofessional. If you do not agree with her 100% about climate change, you will be laughed at. And I was. She has strong political beliefs. After Nov. 8th, 2016, she walked into the class and told us that "The sun will come up tomorrow...". Would not recommend.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: Tell me why I am spending more time studying and doing work for this env. sci. class in a semester where I am taking calculus and several business classes???!! Takes way too seriously for a core class. Lady its mandatory, ease up on everything! Would recom. other profess's based on the amount of work and time you'll have to dedicate alone.
rating_tags: Caring--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: The homework is a must it can really help your grade overall. Test 1 attempt and quizzes 2 attempts are straightforward if you study the chapters. You have 4 Discussion boards only 1 at random is graded. Lowest grades on assignments dropped. Not the best on communication but I did well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria

comment: very caring and gives LOTS of extra credit. if you take her for sci1102 her lecture on population is the best!  you need to buy your own scantron for the tests. final is cumulative. the material becomes dry but I think it's mainly due to the subject. Would take her again if I needed to.4 tests including the final, online assignments due every  week
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Online for science society and the environment. Professor Alme is fairly hands off but there are TONS of reading assignments, videos and supplemental material. There are 4 discussions, weekly lab, weekly quiz, 3 exams and weekly MES assignments. If you do the readings and take notes, you will be ok. All on lockdown browser, so take paper notes!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: **TAKE PROFESSOR ALME FOR GEOLOGY!!**  She has an abiding passion for Geology and really does her utmost to help her students. I was lucky enough to take her inaugural Geology class at KSU, and it will really help me in future Environmental Science classes. Exams are difficult, not impossible. An AAA++ teacher!

Alme was a very passionate professor and loves what she does. Tests were tough and labs are pretty easy, but labs are tested over as well. Huge class. Final was easier than any of her tests. Offers extra credit assignment with VKSU.
She's hard! She's nice but the tests are not like what you learn. She's words them hard and the homework is hard.

I took the lecture class but DO NOT TAKE THE ONLINE CLASS. She always told us how much easier we had it being in her lecture class because apparently she assigns a ton more homework online. 3 tests and a final, and one homework assignment per week that takes 30 mins. Low input class if you want it to be. I Scored A A B A on exams. Would take again

Homework every due every Friday, Lectures are long but online. TEST ARE AWFUL. Memorize every sentence in the book and lectures and labs and that will get you an A. Shes such a nice person but I cant stand her teaching.

While being a great professor, Mrs. Alme is a great person. I stayed after class a lot to talk to her, and it wasn't always course related. I want take her again. She genuinely cares about her students. I thought tests weren't hard, others disagreed. Weekly online HW. 3 tests + final. Don't expect many bonus points. Work hard and you'll earn an A.

Mrs. Alme is  a wonderful teacher. She loves teaching and it really shows. Her test come straight from the book and most times from her PP which she post on D2L. The labs are really long but all I did was read them and I did just find on the test. she does give extra credit sometimes but I wouldn't count on it because its very unlikely.

LOVE MS. ALME!! She's passionate, excited, funny, and approachable. Loves her field and wants you to as well, even if it's not your major. She cares too much about her students it stresses her out. She's lax on grading labs because they are very long and can be tiresome. 4 exams, weekly quizzes and hw. She will help you however she can, just ask!

Pros: Seems friendly, the material is rather easy if you read/study and do the work, probably one of the easier professors in SCI1101 compared to others Cons: You have to use lockdown browser on quizzes, the labs are useless and will drain your grade if you don't study those, lots of readings/activities to do every week. But I'd take her again

Wonderful speaker and obviously loves what she does. Come to class, take notes and pay attention and you'll get a good grade in the class. Very fun and loves to have the class participate in lectures. Tests cover exactly what is in lectures/on homework.

Worst online class I've ever taken. I've taken 6. DON'T REGISTER. Discussion posts, weekly homework, module quizzes & tests are ok, but the 4 lab quizzes are complete BS. 20 minutes for a 25 question quiz that you can't go back on to review your answers? You can erase a bubble and check answers on the freaking LSAT. This is SCI 1101!!!!! HORRIBLE.

This class was very easy. If you do your homework, you'll do fine. She's very good about posting notes online. I did not find that attendance was necessary. Seriously. I went to class maybe 8-10 times and didn't get below an A on any test; including the final.

Super friendly & knowledgeable. Passionate about what she teaches & encourages you to become more involved. Mastering HW, long exams (but all multiple choice), & long powerpoint lectures. Posts all material AND supplemental material on D2L for those who need some extra help. Loves her job, and it's hard not to learn from someone who truly cares.

Professor Alme is passionate about science and she can come off very intimidating. Her lectures are long and boring. Test are hard, no study guide. Homework due every week. She doesn't care about you only there to lecture, test you , and go home. However, she knows her stuff.

This professor knows what she is talking about. I highly recommend her for students who do not find science interesting or even students who are very passionate about the subject. She knows how to evoke a passion in her students for the subject with her lectures.

Dr. Alme is a great teacher, one of the greatest I've taken. She knows everything there is to know about Earth Science and teaches from experience. nice and respectful to students, really cares for the students. 4 tests, all difficult but if you like earth science and study, you'll do fine. Term paper is the hardest, labs are okay, 2 field trips

Professor Alme is a passionate professor that will work with students, IF you put in the effort. This is the second time I have taken her, first time being 1101. She expects you to educate yourself on the information so that you can use it on the test and in the future. Read the textbook, powerpoints and your notes and you will do fine. BE IN CLASS

I took her for the second half of environmental Science. Ms Alme is a really good teacher but the grade you get on test is your grade. If you read, study and do well on the test, you will get a good grade. If not, you get what you get. No variation.

These tests are absolutely unreal. There is no chance of passing and she doesn't plan on curving. She doesn't care about her students learning AT ALL and is completely rude to everyone that doesn't know as much as her. She expects that none of her students have a life so that they can dedicate 24 hours to her class. She has NO concept of time

Go to class, pay attention to her powerpoints, Study the powerpoints on your own the day before the test and you will at least average a B on the tests. Homework in mastering in not hard, and is great study tool. one of the easier courses ive taken because its just reading a few chapters and learning new information. An "A" can be easily EARNED.

Professor Alme was fantastic. I was a full time student, married with a one year old daughter that was sick most of the semester. I attended every class, read the chapter and completed the online coursework. Her lectures cover important information that WILL be on the test, so be there. If you have questions, she is there so do not hesitate to ask.

This was my first online class and she set the bar high. Very clear assignments and time required to complete them. MES homework and labs were time consuming but not hard. Lots of quizzes! I didn't have to sign up for any other 3rd party websites besides the one for the text book. Discussion forum assignments were easy. Do the work, make an A.

If you have a full load of classes, do NOT take this class.  I took the ONLINE class and spent countless hours reading the book, doing the 1 12 to 2 hour labs, the weekly quizzes, mastering env lab weekly, plus about 8 online reading assignments that various quiz questions are pulled from.  I agree that there must be less work in the classroom.

I just finished taking the online class.  The workload is extremely heavy for online compared to the classroom version.  You have a zillion extra readings every week including movies, articles, and discussion.  You also have a lab to do each week and 4 lab quizzes, 4 tests, 4 discussion and a 2 hour mastering environmental science due every week.

Online class is a TON of work.  You have a lab to do every week and you have to purchase the online Mastering Environemental Science which has about 1.5 hours of homework each week.  Then, you have to read the chapters for a weekly quiz.  It is the equivalent of 2 classes for the online class.  I would take the classroom instead.  Less work

Karyn was a pretty awesome teach! She can be pretty harsh, she called out a few kids in class during the semester. Her PowerPoints were a perfect study guide for the test. She basically highlights everything she wants you to know and it's only a matter of memorization. ** Memorizing terms is a must **

A great person and professor! Expect to work very hard for an A in this class. You will have to devote your semester to this class because of the weekly online homework (easy), the weekly online labs (not required to do but 10 questions are on test about them), and the long PowerPoints. She does make class very interesting and exciting to learn.
As a person, I really liked her. She will email you back quickly and is very passionate about Science. Her tests are wayyyyy too hard though and if you are borderline, she will not bump you up.

It was the best decision ever to take this class online! I made a "B" because everything was so straight-forward. It would have been a lot for a regular lecture class, but it was manageable online! I definitely recommend taking her! I wasn't a big fan of the discussions, but other than that it was not bad at all!

There is a ton of material to study for the 4 tests.  Just PPTs, but a ton of slides.  I only went to class for the 4 tests and pulled out a great grade, I just studied for the tests a few days in advance for a few hours each day.  You can never show up except test days and get a 'B' EASILY as long as you study the PPT slides for a few hours.

The material is interesting, but she gives a ton of work for the ONLINE class.  Aside from reading the chapter, you have about 10 extra assignments each week being a video, supplemental reading, or discussion.  Her lab quizzes are tricky and you barely have time to finish them.  Her tests are not that bad, but definitely not easy.  She is very kind

she posts all the powerpoints online, study them, even the details for the test then you should be fine. i did't do any of the labs, just read them and remember important points and vocabs. you can also find most of the answers online for weekly homework assignments,

At the beginning I didn't really enjoy her class but by the end of the semester she was one of my favorite teachers. Go to class, listen, she posts all her notes. The power points are the most important things to study

The tests are really tough. I didn't go to class everyday but still managed to get an A on every test. It takes much studying! She posts her notes online and you have weekly online work. She's very enthusiastic about the topic which is good. But class is still boring at times. Would only recommend if you love environmental science as much as her.

Professor Alme is a sweet lady and very passionate about science. There isn't a lot of work (only MES and tests) but she has a lot of articles, discussions, videos, and movies that aren't for a grade but they are "fair game" for the test so it's a lot of prep for test day. Not exceptionally hard, but definitely NOT an easy A.

Professor Alme is a straight shooter. She clearly outlines what to expect from the class and from her, is passionate about the subject, and cares about teaching it to students. If you are looking for an easy A, don't take her class. If you want to work for what you get and learn a ton, this is the class to take. Highly recommend her! Cool lady, too

Professor Alme is the best. She truly cares for her students and really knows her information. Her lectures are extremely long and doesn't dismiss the class until the very last minute, though. Her exams are fair. If you're naturally good at science then take her. For others, you might have to study a bit harder.

i'm an A student and this class is so much work. mThe labs take me 2 hours to do, at least.  The MES is helpful as you have no time limit.  You have 2 attempts at quizzes, but they make you really think.  The Exams are just plain HARD.  I studied a week ahead of time for tests and never made above a B.  I honestly don't know how anyone gets an A.
Even easier than her 1101 course!

Professor Alme is amaze-balls! I loved this class! The labs are the only "difficult" portion of this class, and they were not hard. She posts all of the lecture power points online so if you miss a class it's no big deal.

Truly the best professor I've had at KSU. Smart, funny, and interesting. She's tough but fair when it comes to assignments and tests. This class is definitely a challenge but you will learn more than you can imagine in just a semester. Wish I could take her every semester!

Alme is an incredible professor. I ended up liking going to class. You will learn applicable life skills in this class and gain a ton of new, interesting information. Yes, her tests are hard, but they are straight off the powerpoints. Just start studying early on.

Professor Alme is great in that she's super nice & if you email her, she answers quickly, & thoroughly. However, Exams are tough. Exams are 50 questions & quizzes 10-15. Typically you can score very well on the quizzes bc, you get 2 Attempts, and they relate to the Textbook reading Material. You will be all over the place. No LIFE allowed!

Alme is AMAZING. I refuse to take Science 1102 with anyone but her. She's easy to listen to and obviously very passionate. She requires work but it's too not hard, just study the powerpoints and pay attention - she's VERY clear. She's always helpful and sweet and overall a wonderful professor here. Attendance is helpful but she's very interesting!

Alme is very kind and engaging. You can get an A withough buying the textbook, the test are directly from her powpoints whjich she goes over and posts on D2L. I printed and studies all the notes before the test and I completed the labs on time, so I did well and enjoyed her class.

Alme is a great teacher, she is very patient, and understanding. She is a very nice person. That being said... she is hard and you have to study ALOT.. Plan to not have a life when you take this course.
She is hard but fair and if you actually put in effort there is no reason not to pass.

A very interesting and compassionate teacher, HOWEVER her test are way to hard for a first level class. Even if you know and are able to apply the materials on the test a lot of the test question are still incomprehensible Study the labs and go to class. Due to the difficulty of the class I lost hope. Take this class if you want a challenge.

Alme's tests are extensive and can be hard to study for, but if you listen to her lectures and go over her powerpoints and study you can get a good grade. She is funny and clearly knows her stuff and listening to her was interesting. However, she is very strict on grading and will not bump you up even if it is by one point. Some extra credit.

I absolutely LOVED Mrs Alme! She's so passionate about the subject and if you talk to her one-on-one she's also super sweet!If you read the chapters in the book and/or the notes you should do fine! The final is cumulative, but it wasn't really that terrible. Overall it was a really fun class!

She seems nice and passionate about her subject. Her lectures are interesting, but it's difficult to take in all of the material, and sometimes she goes off on a tangent. Overall, though I went to all of the lectures and read the textbook, doing well on the tests and studying the material were both difficult tasks.

Enthusiastic to an almost obnoxious degree; while it's nice to see a professor so excited about her subject, it's not so nice to be fed info with no relevance along with the minimal amount of info that you are actually tested on.  Made a few ableist remarks to me that I didn't appreciate.  Don't expect respect should you speak with her one on one.

Professor Alme was awesome! Her lectures were great, she was really enthusiastic! I hate the online homework, but that's not her fault I'm sure. Tests were fairly easy to study for. Attendance not required, but if you want do well in the class you should go. Plus, the lectures were always interesting anyway.

I love how passionate and interesting Professor Alme is! Even though attendance is not mandatory, I never missed a class because of the discussions. In order to pass the tests you need to read the book. I disliked science, but now I am a fan due to her.

This is challenging course but well worth it. Professor Alme is excited and passionate about the material. She will gladly meet with you should you have questions. She responds quickly to emails. Just go to class, pay attention, and do your labs and HW and you will get a decent grade and come out of it with some valuable knowledge.

Her tests are extremely difficult but if you go to class, do your assignments and study you will do fine. I HATE science and I really enjoyed her class. She is passionate about what she teaches and makes learning about science fun. She wants you to get a good grade and is willing to help you in any way she can but she is NOT going to give it to you

Alme is very passionate, but misinformed. Her information is out of date, her power points are ridiculously long, and because of this she cannot cover all of the information in her classes. She is ridiculously harsh on her extra credit. Her final is cumulative, which leaves me to study 300 + slides for my final in her class. this is a Gen Ed course

I absolutely LOVE Mrs. Alme! She's very passionate about the subject and as long as you read the power points (which she always posts online) and skim the sections in the book you'll do fine! I suggest attending class because the discussion is interesting, but it's not necessary to do well  :) I definitely suggest this class to everyone!

Do not take her class if you are not a good test taker. Her class is based on just the test and a little bit of mastering. If you are good at studying and look forward to studying this material every day then take her

Very passionate teacher. Tests aren't as hard as what people are saying. If you back and go through all her power points (THAT SHE PUTS ONLINE) before the test then you'll be fine. I would take her again if I could.

Professor Alme is a very passionate and great professor. You do have to study quite a lot for this class and the material isn't the easiest. But she gives you extra credit opportunity and will be willing to meet up with you if you have any questions. All the material you learn will be beneficial to you and I greatly enjoyed it as a gen ed course.

Professor Alme is a very knowledgeable woman. The class was way more difficult than it should be especially for a Gen Ed/core class. I took notes, studied hard, read textbook and made low C's on every test. The test questions are worded tricky and she concentrates too much on detail. Unless you're good at science don't take her.

Don't take Alme. Lectures are boring, and not explained well. Tests are difficult, even if you take notes, study both book and lecture notes. Her syllabus says the final is non-cumulative. She lied. It is cumulative. I don't recommend her at all. This class has been misery to say the least.

Honestly she's actually pretty great for a professor of 200+ students. Lectures are as engaging as they can possibly be. Personally I rarely went to class and would read the textbook, study the power points posted online, and complete the mastering homework, and I consistently got 86s on the tests. Pretty fair considering my spotty attendance!

DO NOT TAKE HER!!! Her tests are insane! And the final is comprehensive! She is by far the hardest teacher ever. It is impossible to study enough for these tests and I have a 3.8 gpa and barely got a B! Ridiculous!

Professor Alme will challenge you, attempt to teach you critical thinking skills, expect you to UNDERSTAND the material, and help you understand anything you do not. Do not expect to put forth a half ass effort and  pass/do well. You actually have to apply yourself, do your homework, study and LEARN how to think for yourself. She ROCKS!

DO NOT TAKE HER! On her tests "there is a right answer, and a more right answer" so it makes the tests almost impossible to make an A on. If you do have to take her, attendance isn't mandatory, just make sure to read your book and do the online homework! I made it out of there with a B, and hardly went to class.

do. not. take. this. class. with. this. professor. makes it seem like an upper level course when the material should be fairly easy. the tests are impossible to get an A on, she designs it this way. went to every class and read the chapters and took seperate notes and still never got an A, and i am a 4.0 student. do yourself a favor and stay away

took the four week session, and it was difficult  because it was a sixteen week course put into a  four week session so it was a lot of info . She keeps things interesting as much as she can and gives you power points that have all the info you need for the test. Read the book, do the home work, and study the power points and you should get an A.

Had tons of powerpoint slides, tons of information which made it hard to determine what needed to be studied and what didnt. However most questions come from reading the chapter. Powerpoints seem to be useless. Loves the subject and at time extremely preachy, doesnt drop a test grade at all, so be careful to study everytime around.

terrible teacher. She does not help you very much and is very hard to get in touch with. too many slides and does not help you determine what is important and not so you are constantly studying things that are not on the test. would never take again or recommend.
By far the hardest teacher I've taken at Kennesaw. She is nice as a person, but she gives us too much information to study to not have a study guide.

She's kind of tough, and attendance is mandatory. As far as teaching goes, she's a little boring but relatively easy. She's not my first choice for basic environmental science but she's ok, you could still take her

This class was VERY informative! Professor knows her stuff and helps you when you need it, go to her though with questions. Mastering Geology was EXTREMELY helpful in understanding and reinforcing the material in class and lab which showed up on the exam. Attendance is mandatory which helps you learn the material.

She is a very sweet lady with a lot of passion for science. She is pretty strict about a few things but is very helpful and clear about everything. Her passion for science really helps to make a potentially uninteresting subject very interesting. She does not drop any grades but does let you make up test if an emergency arises on a test day.

This was one the best classes I've taken at KSU. Don't get me wrong, her class is definitely challenging, but she is so passionate about what she teaches, it's almost impossible to not learn anything. If you pay attention, her notes come straight from the book. This is an upper level college class so it won't be an easy A. STUDY!

a ton of slides and a ton of information.. she moved through the slides too fast and didn't help us try to figure out what was important and what wasn't. never used the book. got A's on the first 2 test and a B on the final(I should have got an A) and got a B in the class.. did not add up at all.. i asked her and she never replied.useless!
Study hard! She helps a lot with extra credit work

Her intentions a great, very passionate about the subject she teaches. Gets a little too emotional when class doesnt "play with her" . No study guide for test, powerpoints are way too complex, No test grades are dropped but does offer a little bit of extra credit. Final exam was hard. Attended lectures and still had to record them.Hard but fair

She teaches the class like it is a Master's or PHD science class.  The three tests are pretty easy but the final was hard.  Don't expect to get out of class early or on time for that matter.  This is not a teacher to take if you are bad at science b/c you will have to know every detail of what the power points, book, and she says. Good Luck.

Tough class, you have to really try unless this come easy to you. She treats this class like this is your major class. She was annoying & try to force people to answer questions. Her class is a challenge, but a good challenge to push you. 4 tests & doesn't drop NONE. Her final was HARD!!! I failed, but got an B in the class!! Come to class!!
she really loves her job. but she is super boring and reads off the powerpoints. i hardly went to class and made a B.

Mrs. Alme is awesome!! she's really funny and way passionate about her subject!she expects you to do the work, but once you get a feel for her tests, she's pretty easy. just go to class and do the work, and she'll be enjoyable. she likes participation,and will work with you if you need help. I would definetly reccomend her to anyone and everyone!!

Amazing professor. Loves the job and is willing to help a student if you ask. Honestly enthusiastic about the topic and will talk offline in you need the help. Teaches like its an upper level course because it is college. Awesome Class!

She was an okay teacher, way to interested in what she teaches though. She is definitely a science freak! But her class is not hard, the test are difficult so you MUST study! She adds a few questions from the labs to the end of the tests and I dont believe she gives out extra cedit. overall, a nice lady, who loves her job

Awesome teacher! She puts forth so much for her classes and you can tell when she teaches! She really wants to help you understand what she is teaching. If you need help, she will always make time! She is not only great in the classroom but also a very sweet person who will go out of her way to help! Be prepared to learn something!

Ms. Alme is my favorite professor at KSU- she teaches what she loves and you can tell. The amount of effort you put into her class is reflected in your grade. She is willing to work with you if you need help! Just ASK! She tries so hard to make it interesting! People say bad things on here but I'm sure its because they werent happy with their grade

She teaches like this is an upper level course. She introduces a lot of material, but only will test on 25% of it. Will not give any info on what to expect on exams. Our final (3 classes left) about 200 new power points and it was a comprehensive. The first exam only 11 a?s she graded 187 exams!

The only thing i liked was her love for the subject. But she took it over board. Teached like a phd geology class. For labs it was rare to get a 9/10. Tests have essay questions, make sure you write everything out. Will mark off for everything. I felt like english was her minor

In order to get a B you needed 400 points. My cumulative point added up to 399. Guess what she gave me a "C." I worked my butt off and came to class every session and was a participant. She is a loud mouth and an environmental activist. She also drives an SUV so that completely kills of any credibility that this "professor" has.

ABSOLUTELY LOVED HER!She is by far one of my favorite teachers ever!She really cares about what she is doing and will go far beyond what other teachers will to help you to understand. As long as you are willing to try she is willing to help! Not an easy A but if thats what you are looking for , you might want to reconsider college! Taking her 1102!

Mrs. Alme is awesome! I had no desire to go to class, but she is very passionate. She makes the class fun and gives a small amount of extra credit. Attendance isn't mandatory, but if you want a good grade you should go! Notes are online and she very helpful! Great teacher, I am taking her next semester!

Very excited about the subject. Annoyingly so. 3 exams are the only thing that is graded. Provides some extra credit. Make sure you STUDY for her exams. All this means is you memorize all the key term given which can be difficult if you don't spread out you studying time so start at least 4 days in advance. Can be and easy A if you try.
She is a nice teacher. She gives a little extra credit. All of her notes are online. Tests are quite easy but do require ALOT of studying. Overall, she will challenge you but is a good teacher.

really annoyed me at frist because she is very evasive about tests and material does't really answer question head on, but she is passionate and it is interesting just study powerpoints and you will get an A or B. taking her next semester.

Professor Alme is not in the business of giving As, so if you want an A you will have to work for it. Having said that is good to point out that the usual 10 - 15 people that score As in her class are those who attend her non mandatory classes. She is funny and passionate about what she does, but her class is definitely not a walk in the park.
Class is not mandatory but I'd suggest going. Her class is fairly difficult but is doable. She loves teaching and is good at it. Read the chapter, labs, and powerpoints and you'll do fine.

This class is very easy. Although attendance is not mandatory, it is beneficial to attend just because her power points are so long. She will answer any question you have and she is very knowledgeable. If you take notes, pay attention and read the textbook you should be able to pass. She seems very friendly and wants you to do well.

She doesn't require attendance, which is awesome. During class all she does is read from her power point of notes, which she ends up posting online anyway. Since it's such a large class she doesn't really try to make sure everyone understands. Make sure you READ THE TEXTBOOK.

she really knows her stuff! shows very interesting movies relevant to what she is teaching. willing to answer any questions. book used as a resource. no studyguides given but her ppts are VERY detailed and thats all you really need. a funny and nice lady that wants to see you succeed! but you have to put SOME work in if you really want that A!

She was an amazing teacher. You could really tell that she loves science! She follows the book really well and makes detailed powerpoints. I have a different teacher for 1102 and all I can say is I miss Ms. Alme!

Mrs. Alme is very passionate when it comes to science & she tries to get the students involved as well. She is more than willing to help her students & offers bonus points for various things.  Her test are multiple choice & matching. She seems to be a great person & teacher. I would recommend her to anyone.
Professor Alme was a terrific professor. Her tests came basically off the powerpoints. She was an interesting professor. I am trying to take her for Sci 1102 come this sping.

Great Professor! She talks fast sometimes but if you ask her to slow down she will. She is very passionate about the class which makes it more interesting for the students. She is also just a blast to watch. Just make sure to go to her lectures because it severely helps! I didn't study at all and just went to class and got a B.

I thoroughly enjoyed this class! Lectures were long and covered a lot of material, but she does a great job of not only making them interesting, but also facilitating great discussion. Tests are a breeze if you pay attention in class & read the assigned chapters. No study guides, but available for help. Learned a lot and enjoyed her teaching style

STUDY!! This class you need to read the book. Go to class. Pay attention. Take LOTS of notes. and STUDY. You will work for your grade but she is very passionate about her work. She keeps it interesting. Knows the material. Answers questions. She's entertaining when she teaches.

This is a great teacher who really cares about what she is teaching. Not sure why some find her so hard. But basically show up and you will do fine. I do wish she would go over all tests in class and get rid of that darn cumulative test but other than that she is great.

Very nice professor and very passionate about the subject. She teaches from powerpoints and shows many videos. So its important to go to class if you want to do well. She gives opportunities for extra credit and assignments are easy. Tests are a little more difficult but she posts all notes on Vista. Easy A for those who put some time into it.

She is very passionate about her work, however she talks too fast and covers way too much material for one test. 3 tests and a comprehensive final. No study guide. The tests are WAY too detailed to where they do not just cover the main points. Would not take again.

She is a good professor and really cares about the subject and enjoys teaching. She posts all of her lecture notes online and the labs do not have to be turned in, but some questions from them are on the test. If you just study the notes and read the chapters you should do fine in the class. She is a nice lady and is very approachable as well
Her tests are hard, she posts notes from every class online.  Buy the textbook.  Study hard.  If you study, you will do fine.  I am curently in the class for 3 more weeks and have a high B.

You don't have a lot of work for grades, but her tests are extremely hard. She has too much material, and her questions aren't ones that are main points. Doesn't use study guides. Passionate about the subject, but talks too fast. Keeps you to the very last minute. so hurry for your next class...not my favorite prof.

DO NOT TAKE A CLASS TAUGHT BY HER. She is a nice lady, but her tests have like 70 questions on them from 7 Power Points. She DOES NOT DO STUDY GUIDES. I studied really hard for them and still made C's. And her class is very depressing because all she talks about is that humans are killing everything on the Earth.
great teacher, allows you to do extra credit, class requires alot of work and reading. test are long and a little tricky.

This was the worst class ever! She speeds through the powerpoints and rambles on and on about how humans are killing the environment. She is so boring! I went to every class, took notes, and went to several SI reviews and I still got a D. Her tests cover too much information and she does not tell you what will be on them. She is not helpful at all.

To be honest the class is a lot of work. I don't think it's her fault there is a lot of material regardless of who you take. All the tests are straight from the powerpoint it's not hard it's just a lot of reading. A lot of people didn't do well but there is no way you could fail unless you didn't even read.

do not take her. worst ever. tests are impossible. way too much material. doesn't teach, just reads from powerpoints and expects you to know 1,000,000 things per test. her tests are long and she asks way for too many random details. DO NOT TAKE HER!!!!!!!!!!! DO NOOOOTTTTT TAAAKKKEEE HERRR!!!!!!! SPARE YOURSELF!!!!

Her tests are extremely hard and cover a great deal of information, all of which are impossible to memorize. 300 slides, 3 movies, labs, and the book?! Too much! I'm an all A student and can barely manage a B in this class. But the no mandatory attendance is cool.

She gives a TON of material for tests (chapters, powerpoints, and labs) to memorize. Her tests are LONG with like 120ish questions. She is very willing to help and offers a little extra credit at the end. I tried really hard in that class and only made a B. I don't know what I could have done differently. Great person but tough class. Good luck!

Mixed feelings. On one hand, the grading is very straight-forward. She "requires" the labs to be done, but if you simply read them, you should be fine. She does, however, take every opportunity possible to lecture about how humans are destroying the environment. Not the best teacher, but not the worst, either.

Pretty good teacher! the test were strait foreward no surprises! all info from either ppts which she post online or labs, and inclass videos. loves what she teachs!! liked her so much im taking her for sci 1102!!!!

Very knowledgable and passionate about her subject.  I took her for Env. Science 1 and 2.  She doesn't post the ppt notes before class so just jot down the important stuff she doesn't list on the ppt and study them for tests.  Read the chapter before class because EVERYTHING that is taught is in the book. Study PPTs + go to class = A or B.

Breezes through the ppts fast enough not to be able to get everything down. Tells you every class how your a jerk for destroying the environment. No study guides, doesn't tell you what's on test, includes EVERYTHING on test. AVOID THIS PROFESSOR. Easy on the eyes though
Professor Alme is incredibly helpful and very sweet. Science is my least favorite subject but she made it somewhat interesting.

She was very personable and passionate about her class. She was very helpful when I needed to take the final on a different day than everyone else. She provides power points after class, and she will give hints about test topics as she teaches. No study guide, though. But if you pay attention and study the slides you will do well.

Professors is happy to teach but gets off topic a lot. everything is testable. does not provide power points prior to class, moves to fast to take notes. does not review test's so that students can learn what they missed on test.

This was the easiest class ever. Taking this as a freshman, I realized this is  what a college class should be. Attendance is not mandatory, text book was never used. No homework-only labs, that were never graded, you were quizzed on them. If science is your thing this class is a very very easy A.  Finals are easy if you pay attention/read content.

Alme is passionate about the topic. The tests include everything: slides, videos provided, etc. If you actually go to class, take notes, and revise then you will do well. If you're like half of my class who never show up apart from the quiz or tests then don't expect to do well. Very helpful outside class.

DO NOT TAKE HER IF YOU DON'T ENJOY SCIENCE! You do not need the textbook, but it could help for some. Three tests plus the final which is comprehensive and is worth more than the other tests. There are three easy assignments. Offers extra credit, but it doesn't help much. TONS of information and if you go to see her, she is quite rude.

Big class=no attend. Movies shown= some questions on test. Some questions from labs; never did all of them(not graded) but helpful for tests. If you read the chap, listen to her, watch the movies, and read the ppts> you'll do well.Goes by pnt system(477+ is an A).

Good teacher. Knows the material & is passionate. Offers outside help (SI & online info) and is clear of what is expected. If you pay attention, read the labs, and study, you will do great. FYI reading the labs is all that is necessary, I didn't do any and made all A's & B's!

She will treat you all like you are the cause of the environmental downfall but will not say what she is doing personally to improve the environment.  No study guides.  Will assign extra work on top of the labs then expect you to know it for the test.  Great for high school, not for the University level student.  AVOID

Easiest class I've taken at KSU.  Lecture isn't the most interesting but she gives you the Powerpoint slides to review on your own time.  Study those and read the book and you'll get an A; this is an intro science course after all, not electrical engineering.  She's pretty cool to talk with as well.  No excuse to get less than a B.
SHE IS BORING SO DOES HER CLASS... GO TO CLASS IF YOU FEEL LIKE "HAVING MORE OR ENOUGH NAP"
plz-plz-plz donot take or you r going to fail i have already. might be your turn if you take her and she has max. student failing in her class in KSU

An environmentalist who attempts 2 force her personal beliefs on the class She does not give any credit for attendence or labs When she became fraustrated with the attendence n her class (approx 75 everyday 200 on test day) she begin 2 talk n circles about the importance of attendence No credit for attendce, no show Notes hard to follow!Worse ever

Just go to class and pay attention.  Don't get derailed by student discussions.  She's not kidding about EVERYTHING being fair game.  Pay attention, take notes, and read the book!!!  Don't expect an easy A, but don't write her off, either!

If you want to take a satisfying cat nap, take this class. Nyquil doesn't even work this well.She does not teach, just tells us every class that we are destroying the planet PUH  LEEEZZE

Reads DIRECTLY from the PPT but almost none of what's on them are on the test.never gives a study guide or tells you whats on test. extremely difficult. DO NOT TAKE IF YOU CAN AVOID.only 4 tests, that's all. Probably going t o fail this class.
BEST CLASS I HAVE EVER TAKEN.  DON"T EVEN SHOW UP.  THERE'S NO GRADES AND ATTENDENCE ISN'T NECESSARY.  EASY A.
EASY A

never take her

Not even if you are out of choices. Just take another class and wait for a real teacher. She is hard, useless and classes are boring. She will only read the slides, tons of slides. Prof. Alme made this class very interesting. Her class is difficult but she is always there for u to help u. You can sit down with her after class. BTW, I'm an international student. If I can get B for this class, then you can get A. Don't expect to get A for doing nothing.

This class was fun. I didn't get an A, but I enjoyed coming to her class. She made it interesting and honestly I couldn't have asked for more. I didn't do the labs, but I got the grade I deserved. Mrs Alme is a fantastic teacher that actually likes what she teaches.  If you need a study guide or can't handle taking lots of notes, or think the labs are too hard, DROP OUT OF COLLEGE!! This isn't high school. My only complaint with this class is that she almost over-explains things.

This is a difficult class, but it is college. She is tough, but fair. BTW, she did not create the labs. I don't know why everyone is blaming her for those. As for being a "know-it-all," she's a college professor. Just go to class and don't expect to fall backwards into an A.

THis is the most boring class of all time. I know that science isn't too exciting, but she reads word for word off of her power points. The lab take forever and the tests are alot harder then she leads you to think. If you can don't take her, but if you have to do the work and you will survive.

this professor cannot teach. i didn't understand anything whenever i went to class and all she did was read off the projection screen. the tests are unbelievebly hard and she tells you to study things that are not even on the test. i would not recommend to take her.

This teacher is horrible. Her lecture consist of her reading off the powerpoint slides. She talks to the very last minute of class and expect you to know EVERYTHING in the book because she says it's all fair game for the test. Never take her again

DON"T TAKE HER!! I've made all A's through college and a C in her class. Her lectures are boring and her tests are extremely hard. You pretty much have to memorize the book to gget an ok grade in the class and the labs are on the test, I DON'T advise taking her!
Study power points and labs. You'll do fine. Great teacher!

If there are any smiley faces on these ratings it is because she put them there. She is condesending and a know it all. If you have a good GPA,she will ruin it for you. She is out to prove a point. DONT TAKE HER!!

It helps though to come to class because she gives few quizzes for extra credit and her lectures help you understand the material. Really nice teacher.

She's a great teacher who's very helpful and cares about her students.  There's a lot of material, but she gave me help when I asked for it.  I'm a C-Average student and got an A in this class.  I learned a lot about science.  If you study, you'll get an A.

I was stuck with her after original teacher got sick. She should not be aloud to teach. All she does is read from power points. Talks to us like we are 7. If you ask for help she acts like its our fault and won't help. She won't even answer your questions she just went in circles. In the end I worked my butt off and studied daily for a C.

Prof Alme took away my ego when it comes to school. I am an A and B student and made no less that a C on anything in the past 2 and 1/2 years! I made a 54 on the 1st test and a 46 on the 2nd! No study guide, No Extra Credit, No Clue what is going on, 50+ page powerpoints, 7+pages/day notes, Class seems like a prison cell. ETC.

Worst professor I have ever had. 2 tests and the final. Waste of money and waste of time. I am an A student and Im getting a C. DONT TAKE HER. No study guide, no review, no extra credit. no nothing. Too much info covered in 3 tests.

This teacher is the worst! My class was stuck w/her after our original teacher became sick & could no longer teach. Her tests are ridiculous. She has LONG Power Points (50+ pages). I was not happy about science class being mandatory for all students but I really enjoyed this one. It is challenging but very interesting. She does want you to do well.

This teacher has no clue how to use powerpoint.  She doesn't use the book all that much, most of the info is from the notes she gives out in the form of powerpoint.  Must spend hours reformatting each 55+ slideshow before you can print or study them.  Most of the text is not in the slide view range and she packs up to two pages in the notes section

I would not tell my worst enemy to take Prof. Alme! She is by far the worst teacher that I have ever taken at KSU! She gets off track at times and refuses to give students any assistance other than 2pt extra credit quizzes.

Nice lady though.

She is Buffy in that perky lil way (had Buffy been a teacher).  Tough because of the memorizing. Loves her subject!  Sometimes boring and she goes soo fast. She tries hard to get smiles out of you in a fledgling stand-up comic way. But, she is just cuteness though. Memorize those mega powerpoints and you will be just fine.
Boring class but super easy. She likes Science but I am just required to take it and listen. Study the powerpoints VERBATIM and you have an A. Pure memorization.

First of all she thinks she is teachng an upper level science class which she is not. Second this was a science requirement of KSU when I tranferred.Not sure why. If she was the only impression I got regarding teachers at KSU it would be a poor one. For a CORE science class she made it pure torture.If you are a freshman take someone else!

Two things:  She relases the PPTs after she lectures which is really annoying and she likes to ask trick questions on the tests.  For example:  "which is not an example of ....?" and all the answers are examples of "..."  She is really excited about the subject matter which is nice though.

Very organized and interesting. She did offer one extra credit assignment as well as few in class quizes for extra points(you won't know it unless you come to class). She does cover a lot of material but everything you need is on PPT. I did not have a book and did well just reviewing her notes. Very helpful. Does not check attendance.

Please... the people who rated her high must be relatives. She likes to talk on and on and likes the sound of her own voice. She is not willing to bend for any extra points. So if you have the integrity to go to class and get your grades honestly, TAKE ANOTHER PROFESSOR. My feeling is she is in this for her not for you.

I had Prof Bowers as the SCI 1101 and when he got ill they got this woman to come in and take her place.  Prof Bowers did not require a textbook, she does.  Prof Bowers allowed us to do extra credit which some students have already done, and she won't accept it.  She won't even post the PPT slides before class so I can use them with onenote.

Teacher is tough but fair.  Expects a lot from students.  Enthusiastic and extremely knowledgeable.  Very willing to help out students between classes.  Class was full of powerpoints and videos.  Tests were multiple-choice.  Expect to spend time studying, but to learn a lot.

I absolutely loved her. I almost dropped it the 1st day b/c she takes a basic Science 1102 class too seriously but she really loves it and made the subject extremely interesting! She does have tons of powerpoint slides but she will give you test questions during the lecture & all questions on powerpoint in a different color u need to study & know!

People complain that she goes a little too fast in class, but she puts the powerpoints online, which is what I used to study for the tests. You don't even need to take too many notes in class. She tells you certain things will be on the test, and that's all I really wrote down. Other than that, just study the bold words on the powerpoint.

She's passionate about teaching and is very knowledgeable about science/the environment, and I think that's what makes her class interesting. I learned a lot. She tries to get to know her students, and her tests are VERY easy. She covers lots of info, but the tests are NOT hard AT ALL if you just study a little. She gives quizzes for bonus points.

RUN!  Take someone else, she is simply too inexperienced; she has a point to prove, and it comes at the expense of the students.  Take someone who is more experienced and secure.  Clearly, everything is about her.  She is very inconsiderate, and she acts as if this is a higher level Sci course.  RUN! RUN! Run!

Oh! My Goodness!  I am currently taking this Professor, and I can hardly wait for the semester to END!  So far, I have an A avg. in the class, so I do not speak grudgingly.  This lady must not have a life outside of class; she talks just to hear herself talk, and much of the time her lectures exceed class time.  Simply put, she is there to show off

This professor is very passionate about what she teaches but does not always get her point across very clearly. This woman likes to torture you with all her talking to prove how smart she is, but does nothing for teaching. Test are hard. You can get all the info from powerpoints so if you want to go to class, you can sleep through the whole session and not miss a thing.Take another teacher if possible.

This woman likes to torture you with all her talking to prove how smart she is, but does nothing for teaching. Test are hard. This is the only class she is teaching and it is obvious. She babbles on endlessly past class time about nothing. When you ask what is on the test, she says "everything". Wonderful teacher...she makes it easy for her students to succeed. She is very knowledgeable and it is clear that she loves what she does. Very clear about expectations and provides students with everything they need to succeed on tests. Her class is by no means an easy "A" but if you put some effort into it you should have no problem.

She is a very nice person, just hasn't quite mastered teaching a lecture class. She covers a TON of material, the study guide is a 10+ pg outline, and she goes WAY too fast. She's knowledgeable and would be great in a smaller setting. I only got a B cuz she added extra credit at the last min.

I honestly got the impression of Mrs. Alme that she did not care whether her students got the information or not.  She rushed through the material and when she did decided to put the power points online they were always last minute.   The worst teacher in my KSU experience.

Mrs Alme was a very good teacher- for the record- this class wasnt useless and she taught in a way i could understand. But she covers ALOT of information if you want to pass this class you need to be willing to put the effort into it. She is MORE than willing to help -i had a science question for another class and she helped and added suggestions.

DO NOT TAKE HER!!!She is horrible...her "study guides" are ten freakin pages. She wont give extra credit b/c she thinks that's puttin us at competition with each other...umm how? she is obsessed with giving you inspirational quotes everyday, she'll read them & then stand there waiting for a reaction, never figures out that no one cares. refused 2 put the powerpoints online at the beginning, people fussed so she put them online, after that she wouldnt give us time to take notes b/c she had the excuse that that they r online

Teaches to entertain herself, doesn't really care if you learn or not. She is very knowledgeable but is a horrible teacher.
